metadata.title: CVE-2020-11494 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in slc_bump in drivers/net/can/slcan.c in the Linuxkernel 3.16 through 5.6.2. It allows attackers to read uninitializedcan_frame data, potentially containing sensitive information from kernelstack memory, if the configuration lacks CONFIG_INIT_STACK_ALL, akaCID-b9258a2cece4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-101-generic - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-101-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-101-lowlatency - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-101-generic - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-101-lowlatency - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1071-kvm - 4.4.0-1071.78
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1107-aws - 4.4.0-1107.118
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1067-aws - 4.15.0-1067.71~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1083-azure - 4.15.0-1083.93~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1071.78').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.118').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.71~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1083.93~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.81~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1039.43~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.142').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.145').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
